description: Spain combines a relaxed Mediterranean lifestyle with modern European infrastructure. It is highly regarded for its excellent healthcare (Index: 77.3) and high safety levels (Index: 62.8). The cost of living (Index: 48.6) is moderate for Western Europe, offering good value for retirees. While English proficiency is moderate (535), the welcoming culture and established expat communities make integration feasible. The 'Non-Lucrative Visa' is a popular choice for retirees with passive income.

visas.name: Tourist Stay (Schengen Short-Stay)
visas.description: Visitors from many countries (including the U.S. and Canada) may enter Spain without a long-stay visa for up to 90 days during any 180-day window; this route is for short-term stays only and cannot be used for applying for residency from within Spain.
requirements: Valid passport (often visa-free for up to 90 days within a 180-day period).
Entry under Schengen rules for up to 90 days during any 180-day period.

visas.name: Non-Lucrative Visa
visas.description: A residency route for persons who have passive income (such as pensions, dividends or investments) and wish to live in Spain long-term without working; the visa is valid for one year and renewable for two-year periods as long as requirements are maintained.
requirements: Applicants must demonstrate an annual income of at least €30,000.
Health insurance and a clean criminal record.
Medical certificate showing no communicable diseases.
Applicants may not engage in professional or economic activities in Spain.

visas.name: Digital Nomad Visa
visas.description: A visa designed for remote workers who want to live in Spain while working for foreign (non-Spanish) employers; valid up to one year and renewable for up to five years under certain conditions.
requirements: Non-EU/EEA nationals working remotely for employers or clients outside Spain, with no more than 20% of income derived from Spanish sources.
Applicants generally need to prove a stable income of around €2,000–€2,500/month, though amounts may vary slightly.

visas.name: Investor Visa (Golden Visa)
visas.description: A residency route for investors willing to make significant investments in Spain (real estate, companies, funds or bonds); allows initial two-year permit followed by five-year residency and counts toward permanent residency/citizenship under certain conditions.
requirements: Purchase real estate in Spain worth at least €500,000.
Or invest €1 million in Spanish bank deposits or Spanish companies.
Or invest €2 million in Spanish government bonds.

visas.name: Permanent Residency
visas.description: After meeting residency and stay conditions under a long-term visa route, foreigners can apply for permanent residency in Spain, which grants the right to work and live indefinitely in the country.
requirements: Qualifying applicants (from non-lucrative, digital nomad or investor visas) can apply after five uninterrupted years of residency (of which at least four years must be spent in Spain).
